meanings.sent1: The whale swam gracefully in the ocean.
meanings.sent2: I saw a whale breach the surface of the water.
meanings.sent3: The whale decided to take a vacation to the Caribbean.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the room like the song of a whale.
meanings.sent5: The whale's tail slapped the water with a mighty splash.

meanings.sent1: He will whale the ball out of the park.
meanings.sent2: She whaled the punching bag with all her strength.
meanings.sent3: The chef will whale the dough to make it fluffy.
meanings.sent4: The storm whaled against the windows all night.
meanings.sent5: The carpenter whaled the hammer onto the nail.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that is very large or powerful.
meanings.sent1: He was a whale in the business world, making big decisions.
meanings.sent2: The new superhero movie features a powerful whale as the villain.
meanings.sent3: The whale of a man had a heart as big as his size.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was a whale in the music industry, commanding attention.
meanings.sent5: The company's CEO was a whale in the tech field, leading with innovation.
